result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice A Shegonee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • 946.41 Resisting or Obstructing Officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The commitment order for non-payment will be consecutive to any sentence that the defendant will be serving.
The committment order for non payment will be consecutive to any jail time that the defendant is serving.
Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice A Shegonee

From Attorney Cveykus requesting DE be allowed to transfer to MSDF - Judge would like an order to be drafted. JA faxed information to Attorney and DA.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:10 PM. State - resolved. Cveykus - 16CF15 - plead G to count #1 as alleged; 15CM208 - amend count #1 to county ordinance of obstructing an officer with a fine of $500 plus costs, plead to count #2 as alleged - 60 days jail in FC jail, plus costs, on 16CF15 - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 year with conditions of: 180 days jail of conditional jail, reimburse Forest County Drug Task Force of $150.00, employment/school, absolute sobriety, AODA and follow t hru, 84 days credit on 16CF15 only if revoked and no credit on 15CM208, asking for 60 days to be concurrent to probation. State's intent was for the probation to be consecutive to jail time. Cveykus responds. Cveykus and Shegonee agree with agreement as stated. State also asking for 300 hours of community service and obtain GED/HSED or high school diploma. Cveykus and Shegonee have no objections to those additional conditions. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 on 16CF15. Shegonee pleads G to count #1 as alleged on 16CF15. Court - 15CM208 - amend count #1 to ordinance violation of resisting an officer, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - 60 DTP/CO - consecutive to any jail time being served. Shegonee pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Shegonee makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM208 - count #2 - 60 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), costs - paid within 60 days/CO; 16CF15 - #1 - withhold sentece and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent on sentence in 15CM208 -  with conditions of: 180 days jail - huber allowed - concurrent to jail time on 15CM208 - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m), $150.00 costs to Forest County Drug Task Force - 60 DTP/CO, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 150 hours of community service - to be completed within first year of probation, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain HSED/GED or HS diploma, AODA and follow thru, costs - 60 DTP/CO, 84 days credit if revoked, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, no possession of firearms and no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Status conference on April 6, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:58 AM. 16CF15 PH will be waived. 15CM208 - here for FPT, is not resolved. 16CF15 - Court goes over waiver of PH form with defendant and finds he is freely and voluntairly waiving his right to a PH. Finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Info filed, mirrors. Proceed to ARGN. Cveykus waives further reading of information and enters NG pleas to all counts. Bond continued. Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in custody from FC jail, in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called 15CM208 and 16CF15 at 9:54 AM. State did not send an offer on 15CM208 and here for AIA on 16CF15. Cveykus has complaint on 16CF15, waives further reading of it, waives time limits. Court considers time limits waived and will set 16CF15 for PH. Cveykus makes statement prior to setting it for PH, wants defendant to go into inpatient in April. Court continues bond on both matters, sets 16CF15 for PH and sets 15CM208 for another final pre-trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.  16CF15 - Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:43 AM. Cveykus and Shegonne have complaint. Cveykus waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant appears from FOSO via video. State appears by Jody Bednar. Defendant indicates he is on a 30 day PO hold. Court will modify bond to $1000 signature bond. Defendant asks if he should contact an attorney. Court advises it would be a good idea to contact an attorney once a complaint is filed. AIA set for 10/14/15 at 9:45 AM.
